Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: cwordpro
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera for a trip to Canada.  It takes great pictures! Especially at night using the night mode.  I got some awesome pictures of the Falls at night when they were illuminated. Almost like professional pictures - very clear.  Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for $100
Reviews.Author: ELMJAM
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera because it is smaller than my old 2 Megapixel Canon. It has all the basic features that the average photographer should need and takes fine quality photos. Why pay more? It's a great camera for a modest price and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: just what I wanted!
Reviews.Author: Regina Philange
Reviews.Content: Although our Canon powershot ('05) takes great pics, I've been wanting to get a lighter camera, as the Canon is too heavy. I'm sure there are lighter weight Canon's, but my husband picked out this model for our son to take on his trip to Germany. We wanted a decent camera for him for under $100, and this more than met our expectations!It takes GREAT pictures! And, my son has figured out so many things about it (panoramic shots for one), that I wanted one of my own.I love that it has a rechargeable battery that you can just recharge by plugging in the wall.I'm a picture freak and take our camera to a lot of events for my children (cc races mainly, art festivals, games), and this is so much lighter to tote around (I like to carry it in a little cross-body bag) especially in the hot weather.Love it! GREAT product! Easy to use (although the instruction booklet is limited), but you can find more details online.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Victor Gaines "DEMO"
Reviews.Content: This item is better than advertised.  It is to use as well as sharing photos is a breeze.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: Ryan Maloney "corndogs"
Reviews.Content: I recently received this camera as a b'day gift, and I couldn't be more happy with it!  Right out of the gate, one of the first things you'll notice is it's size, which is small to say the least.  I've got a Blackberry 8330, and it's much smaller than the 8330 is.  Secondly, you'll immediately notice how quick this phone is to turn on.  It will only be a second or 2 after hitting the power button that the phone is on, and immediately ready to take beautiful pictures.  The quality of all the pictures I've taken thus far are great, and I've not had any problems.  I will say, make sure to press the button half way, then fully push the button and take the shot.  If you quickly press the button all the way, the camera will most likely not take a picture that's focused.  Anyway, I recommend the camera, and hope other people out there are enjoying it as much as I am.

Reviews.Title: Slow to focus, short life
Reviews.Author: sterkte
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take to Singapore for several months of training required for my company. It took blurry pictures many of the times and required a long time to get a good focused picture. If you did manage to get something you had to wait 4-5 seconds and "that moment" rarely will wait that long for the picuture to look ok.There were three occasions that the picutes were loaded from the camera to my computer. The first two times worked fine, but on the third time the camera failed. It just stopped working and now will not turn on, it flashes the light next to the power button and ends there. Less than three months and it is gone. I will be stuck across seas for the last month with no way to get pictures I guess. Hopefully I can find something that will work in the states when I get back.I had an 8MP camera from kodak as well, it lasted a bit longer and took ok pictures, but also had issues with length of time you had to wait to take a good pitcure. The 8MP camera also just randomly stopped working as well. This is a you get what you pay for I guess, will probably avoid Kodak from now on. Need to find something that will last longer than a couple months and has the ability to take pictures of somthing that does not stand still all the time.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Especially for the Price
Reviews.Author: D Whitehouse
Reviews.Content: Takes really good pictures.  Really easy to use.  I have another camera that costs 10 times as much and probably does take slightly better pictures and has lots of manual options (which I initially liked but seldem use), but because the Kodak takes great pictures and is so easy to use and put in your pocket, we take a lot of shots with it.  Nice job Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Did not hold up
Reviews.Author: Mr. Ross S. Williams
Reviews.Content: You sacrifice quality in construction with this small size camera.  It worked okay for 3 months and then the battery would not charge.  The focus and zoom lens acted wacky at times spoiling photos.  I wanted a cheap small camera to save my expensive Canon on hiking trips, this one did not work out for me.

Reviews.Title: Reliable, inexpensive
Reviews.Author: PAT
Reviews.Content: The 2Easyshare  cameras I have owed have both worked perfectly. They are good for snapshots and very easy to keep in a small purse or pocket.

Reviews.Title: Works fine
Reviews.Author: Arturo Peris
Reviews.Content: I took good picture with it. Is very small and light. very good camera. The only concern is that it don't automatically put the date on the pictures; I need to insert the date manually...

Reviews.Title: its okay
Reviews.Author: patrick Valentie
Reviews.Content: the camera doesnt have a verry wide angle on it its the first easy shot ive owned that was like this the camera isnt realy great in other aspects either charging is difficult uploading the pics is dificult any way no big deal

Reviews.Title: eASY tO uSE cAMERA
Reviews.Author: Mary Zahurones
Reviews.Content: great camera  The color is good for finding the camera. It is easy to use and gets good pictures without problems.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Abiola M Muili
Reviews.Content: nice camera..The flash works very well and the quality of the picture comes out good, its kinda of light and durable as well

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: o0oitzJimmy
Reviews.Content: Bought the carbon one in Best Buy, took it to Afghanistan with me & it worked great, had it for about 2-3 years now still works great, just bought the red model for my gf & she loves it.

Reviews.Title: Kodak digital camera
Reviews.Author: iris mckoy-britt
Reviews.Content: This camera works great, I just love it  it has great features and was very affordable. It takes beautiful pictures.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share Camera
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last yr at Office Depot cause instead of lugging around my big Sony camera i wanted something to take quick picks and with an easy and convenience pocket size and this thing fits the build.  Its the same price here on Amazon that when i bought it at Office Depot it takes good pics and i haven't had a single problem with it and its a good little point and shoot camera for taking on short road trips with friends and it takes really good pics.  A buddy of mine was using his camera on his phone and it was a pretty hi tek phone but when he saw the results of how clear it was and for the price he was amazed and was jealous and said "i think i might just have to buy one so i don't brake the camera on my phone." and i had to agree with him and a week later be bought i and he's used it a long since and he loves it and I don't have any complaint's at all I may not have bought that camera here on Amazon but it is defiantly worth buying if u can get it bran new.

Reviews.Title: Great buy !!
Reviews.Author: Jeannette L. Johnson "JayJay"
Reviews.Content: My old Kodak finally gave up and I ordered this one even though Kodak is no longer. I was not disappointed.  It is a great little camera.  So many options and so easy to use.  I am  a point and shoot grandma  and this really works.

Reviews.Title: Survived TWO trips through the washing machine!
Reviews.Author: Becky
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera as a first camera for our 8-year-old son, who is an aspiring wildlife photographer.  He loves the fact that this camera is pocket-size.  He loves taking it everywhere, snapping pics of birds, family, anything he finds interesting.  The really big down side to this camera is it is pocket-size.  :)  Since I believe that the owner of the pants or shorts should clean out his/her own pockets, I don't do it before throwing them in the washing machine.  After I discovered the camera in the bottom of the washing machine, I was absolutely certain it was done.  I researched online and discovered that I had probably done further damage by trying to turn it on.  Although I didn't have much hope, I took out the battery, the SD card, and left the little "door" open.  I put the camera, the battery, and the card in a bowl of rice (completely covered) for two or three days.  At the end of that time frame, I put the card and battery back in the camera and miracle of all miracles it worked!Thinking that our son had learned his lesson, imagine my shock a couple of months later to discover same said camera once again in the bottom of the washing machine.  After pitching a really big fit and telling our son he would have to buy his next camera, I tried the rice trick once again.  Once again, the camera and SD card survived.  The battery didn't make it through the second time, but I wasn't terribly upset because I just couldn't believe how well the camera itself had held up.  The replacement battery was expensive, though, so I thought twice before buying it.I am actually looking at buying another one because the first one has finally met its demise.  My now 9-year-old son was taking a picture when he was hit from behind over the weekend and dropped the camera onto a limestone floor.  That hit, on the front side of the camera, finished it off.  While I can't really attest to the quality of the camera's pictures (you get what you pay for, folks!), this is one rugged camera and makes a great first for kids who want to learn photography.

Reviews.Title: Camera has Defects
Reviews.Author: lucky_baller
Reviews.Content: Shortly after receiving this camera as a gift, I began noticing that it had a major flaw. The 12 megapixel lens produced brilliant pictures indoors, however, when taken outdoors and used in natural light, every photo became tarnished with faint, pinkish streaks. Every other feature on the camera has worked fine, but the poor outdoor image quality has persuaded me to never buy a Kodak product again.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Camera
Reviews.Author: Raven
Reviews.Content: I should have paid more attention to the negative reviews; the old saying you get what you pay for certainly applies here. I bought this camera one year ago this month (4-2011) and already it doesn't work. Now I expect to get more than a year's worth of use from a camera and even if it didn't cost that much it still cost more than it was worth for no more than a year. On top of that it was used maybe half a dozen times tops.

Reviews.Title: Basic Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Milton
Reviews.Content: I just recently purchased this camera (Kodak Easyshare M530) from my little cousin for $40 because he wasn't using it.  That's bout all this camera is worth paying for.  I already own a Nikon D3100 as well as a Panasonic FZ35, but I wanted a small camera I could use without having to lug my DSLR camera around.  This camera is basic, but decent. Nothing extraordinary about it.  The screen is pretty big and it takes decent pictures.  The camera also has numerous camera settings to choose from.  This camera is true definition of point and shoot. Major drawback I found with it is that it takes approximately 2-3 seconds after a picture has been taken to take another one thus=slow. The battery life isn't as long as other point and shoots as well.  Overall I would give it a 3 or 3 1/2.  Compared to other traditional point and shoots it's ok, but nothing exotic.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA i paid $75 bucks for this last year!
Reviews.Author: Jasper Hopkins "RockSteady"
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera in the beginning of 2010 for $75.00 off of amazon. this camera is great. For a point and shoot it takes great pictures, the menu is really easy to navigate. If you are more advanced in photography than you know this is not a camera for a photographer!Yes this camera takes great photos but do not expect to get amazing video quality, it has that grainy yellow to orange tint, when you are indoors or in a dim area.but you didn't pay for a video camera, you paid $100 bucks for a camera that has a great zoom, takes 12mp images, rechargeable battery(with great life), compatible with tripods, has a video camera(great quality outdoors,daytime.) included easy-share software(for Facebook, YouTube) and quick access to a lot of setting for most picture scenarios!with that being said, even though i paid $25.00/less than i did little over a year ago i would Gladly pay the $100 today if mine crashedalso i do not have a screen protector and its 100% scratch freeWORTH EVERY PENNY

Reviews.Title: TERRIIFIC CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: Donna Thrash
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and is very sharp.  It is easy to figut out and simple to use. i would definately  recommend it

Reviews.Title: Hate it!
Reviews.Author: mama b
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera I have ever owned! I get maybe one good picture to 10 blurry ones. Unless I want to go in and change the "scene" everytime I want to take a picture of my kids this camera is worthless! I want to capture the moment as it happens and kids don't sit still or wait for me to set up the camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Hanner
Reviews.Content: I bought this on the recommendation from a friend at work.  It is a great little camera, easy to use, and takes great pictures. I would recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Malfunctioning piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Yvette
Reviews.Content: Everytime I try to charge the dumb thing it blinks a couple times and does nothing.  I've had it plugged in overnight before and no charge was made.  When I try to turn it on, the lens moves in and out and the screen is blank.  WTF??  Not happy with this product and now I have to try to get my money back or get it replaced.  Wish me luck on that!EDIT: So Kodak so called "fixed" my camera.  It was very easy working with the customer service as far as being able to send it off to be repaired.  It was still under warranty and they shipped it back very quickly.  However, I'm having the same problem I had as before and I think I will try to send the camera back and get a refund.  I'm wondering if this will be as easy a task as getting it repaired.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money!
Reviews.Author: Marcelo Villa
Reviews.Content: Handsome and efficient little camera that is easy to use. Great camera for around $80. I have two of them now.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera! And super cute too!
Reviews.Author: Aggie Girl "Aggie Girl"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this camera! Got it when my old one broke and needed a new camera fast. The price on Amazon was sooooo much better than at Target or other similar stores. The camera is GREAT. It holds a charge for a long time, the pictures are beautiful and easy to take. It takes pictures quickly too. And did I mention that since it is red, it is SUPER cute? I am so happy I bought this one!

Reviews.Title: So Amazing
Reviews.Author: Little Electron
Reviews.Content: I only had about $90 to spend on a camera and I was searching everywhere. Thank goodness for Amazon! I did the combo of the Kodak EasyShare and a 4 GB SansDisk and love what I received. This cheap little camera takes better pictures than my friend's Canon digital. I love that it's not bulky like many digital cameras and that it doesn't take batteries. This seems to be more like a $200 camera to me. The only complaint is that other colors are a little more expensive...not much of a red person, but that doesn't take away from the camera quality. I definitely recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: GGMom
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  Bought it so I could always have a camera on hand to catch cute moments from my two small kids. Takes great, clear pictures.My only complaint would be the shutter speed. It is a little slow for my liking, but as I said...great camera for the price and reason I'm using it.

Reviews.Title: VERY impressed for the price
Reviews.Author: Scarlet and Gray
Reviews.Content: I'm a recent college graduate and bought a semi professional Canon camera that I love, but it was much too large to fit in a pocket when I went out on the weekend. I was waiting for a smaller Canon to go on sale, but took a chance on this one when I saw it for $70. I'm glad I did! This camera is slightly thicker than my smart phone but is smaller overall. It travels well to parties and bars and takes clear, detailed (zoom all the way in and see the color variations in friends' eyes in crisp detail), and terrific pictures if you're looking for portraits in low light on an easy setting. I can't comment on pictures in other environments, but if you're similar to me, I'd say this camera is a winner.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera.
Reviews.Author: islandgirl "fran"
Reviews.Content: Like the Kodak EasyShare M530.  Fast delivery. Good price. Gift for a pre-teen grandaughter. It seems easy enough to operate. The easy share button is a nice feature.  Have not developed any photo's yet, but they look good on the computer screen. Happy with purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Reecie
Reviews.Content: This little camera is great.  I bought it for Christmas for the guy I date.  He loves it - it's very small and fits easily into any coat or jeans pocket.  The pictures come out awesome - beautiful color !

Reviews.Title: working fine so far
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Replacing a much more expensive Sony Camera that always blurs.  Kids are always moving so that's the most important aspect.  It also needs to take quick pictures when you press the button.As a test, I asked my kids to jump up and down...worked perfectly catching them in the air...clear and vivid.  When I pressed the button, it took the picture faster than any other camera I've had.  The Sony had the best specs in the $200+ price range 2 years ago when I bought it and this blew the Sony away.I can't speak for the overall longevity but the camera works great so far.I did notice that it's best to let the camera acclimate to the settings (lighting, distance).  I hold it up for a second and it automatically finds the best setting.Update:  Seems to become more blurry over time.  Pictures lately are hit or miss.

Reviews.Title: If you like crummy pictures, buy this one.
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: I really, really dislike this camera. I use it mainly for close-ups of plants and flowers and for short-distance display shots, so others that use it for other reasons may have a different experience. One of my main beefs is poor color rendition in the SmartCapture mode. Even in Flower mode, yellows are too bright, saturated, and sickly. You have to go through the Menu to get into Macro mode, something I use all the time. I didn't realize how convenient a button for it directly on the back of the camera is until I didn't have one anymore.Picture quality in general is my second problem. Often, they just aren't crisp. I don't have the photographic vernacular to describe exactly what the problem is so let's just leave it at: the pictures suck a good portion of the time. The light rendering isn't good or the focus was weird. While my old Canon Powershot rarely let me down in this regard, the Kodak does so with regularity.Last, I hate the buttons on top. You have Power, Flash, Menu and Shutter release buttons all in a row, very small and flush to the top of the camera. That does make it easy for tucking into a pocket but heaven help you if you have butterfingers. The flash button does have a raised area so you can feel it, but I still hit the wrong buttons from time to time.

Reviews.Title: I like it!!
Reviews.Author: GAM
Reviews.Content: Delivered on time and worked better then expected.  Great camera for the price!!  Still leaning more about it.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it
Reviews.Author: silver star
Reviews.Content: I bought it, worked fine for little more than a year and then the flash stopped working. I agree that even when it was not expensive, I expected it to work more than a year. Kodak is not a bad brand but...

Reviews.Title: so so camera
Reviews.Author: Robson
Reviews.Content: I have bought it for my wife and we're disappointed.Picture quality is OK but build quality is very poor.The battery apartment cover got loose after a month,not to mention bad pixel on the screen from the very beginning.Also autofocus works all the time making noise...No wonder kodak gave up camera business.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: D. Hall
Reviews.Content: Sterkte's review from June 2011 is on point. I agree with everything he said. The pictures are pretty good quality, but it takes 3-4 attempts to get a good picture. You have to wait about 3 seconds for the camera to focus or else you'll end up with a blurry picture. If your hands are not completely still, you will also get a blurry picture. The worst thing about this camera is that it DIES! I have had it for about 5 months. I tried to turn it on a few days ago and it wouldn't turn on. I tried charging it for a very long time, but it still won't turn on. Thanks for taking my money, Kodak!

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: A. Barber
Reviews.Content: I bought this around Christmas time last year to replace a 10-year-old Canon digital camera. I wish I still had the camera from 2001. It took better pictures and was easier to use.This Kodak is clumsily designed. It's easy to open the cover and knock the battery out of it. The power button is in an awkward position. The lens will extend after you unplug it from your computer after uploading pictures, which is worrisome if you have the camera laying on the edge of a desk. Its auto focus can be extremely frustrating at times. It also takes forever to refresh the screen to snap quick pictures. I finally discovered that if you click the shutter button again, it will refresh faster.The picture quality is hit or miss. I've had a few very sharp pictures, and others that are complete garbage and unusable. Don't even think about taking pictures in low light.What I do like about it is that it's rechargeable; no AA batteries. The software to upload photos to your computer is easy to use.What I don't like? Just about everything else. I paid around $80 for this and a couple of accessories, and I feel as though I overpaid. Keep looking if you want a nice, reliable, easy-to-use camera that takes good pictures.

Reviews.Title: New in Dec, broken in April
Reviews.Author: nopics_please
Reviews.Content: This camera was a Christmas present for my teenage daughter.  The picture quality was good for her use, she had no trouble uploading photos, etc.  Unfortunately, after 4 months use it simply refuses to turn on--Battery is charged, the camera turns on, then right back off again.She is heartbroken.  No, it wasn't dropped.  It has a Kodak battery, and she used Kodak charging equipment designed for this camera. It worked this morning, it worked last night; something happened while it was not being used, while she was in school.We stuck with Kodak because of excellent luck with an older, CX6330 Easy-share camera.  A lot has changed; compared with the CX6330 the newer camera felt unsubstantial in my hands, very light and awkward to operate.  Settings didn't seem to "stick", so she was constantly re-setting her personal settings.  Got great photos outdoors in evening light, but indoors even with the flash photos had to be "cleaned up" with editing software.Saved up to pay for a mid-level camera, not the most nor the least expensive.  Read the reviews, thought we made a good choice.  I guess the problems show up 3-4 months down the road, after reviews have been written.  Poor kid is going to have to wait until we can save up again for a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware !
Reviews.Author: freckles "freckles"
Reviews.Content: To those consumers shopping around to buy a simple point and shoot camera. Please do not buy the Kodak M530 this camera was made with poor quality. I had my camera in my pocket and bumped my car door. As a result, the LCD display broke and I could no longer view the pictures that I took. I called Kodak customer service and they indicated to me that it was my fault and would not fix my camera. So I vowed that I would never buy another Kodak camera due to its poor quality and duarabilty issues. So I am warning other consumers please do your research before making a purchase with your hard earned money. Go with the pros Cannon, Olympus, and Nikon. Don't go with the Ford of the camera world-Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Very bad in sub-optimal lighting
Reviews.Author: hansmuff
Reviews.Content: The camera has nice features and all for the price, but the pictures are terrible unless you have perfect lighting conditions. In low light and indoors, getting good pictures out of this camera is not easy, that's to say, much harder than it should be.I'm also not fond of the tiny buttons on the top -- not a deal-breaker by any means but ergonomically bad choice.

Reviews.Title: Continually out of focus...
Reviews.Author: Cecilia R. Cygnar
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kodak digital camera and I stayed with the brand since I was VERY happy with the first two.  This one, though, has been a continual disappointment.  Since day one, about 75% of the pics I take are out of focus, even though the subject and camera are still.  I've even sent it back to Kodak and they replaced the entire lens but it still is not up to the quality I had come to expect with the first two Kodak cameras.  I have even resorted to using my older Kodak again instead, which worked fine but just was older and has a small view screen -- but at least it takes pictures that are in focus!

Reviews.Title: Horrid
Reviews.Author: jennifer griffithe
Reviews.Content: The KODAK M530 is the worst.  The pictures blur.  Also, I detest the share feature and there's no easy way to shut that off.It's being replaced with another NIKON Coolpix.

ProductInfo.Features:
12-megapixel resolution for stunning prints up to 30 x 40 inches
3x optical zoom
2.7-inch LCD with KODAK Color Science Technology
Kodak's Smart Capture feature; Face Recognition feature
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare M530 12 MP Digital Camera with 3x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Red)
